function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Improper HVAC operation during the COVID-19 pandemic","Impact":"Increased risk of airborne virus transmission leading to potential infections","Mitigation":"Maintain HVAC operations at lower speed to ensure effective air circulation, investigate the effect on energy consumption, and include in novel energy standards","Technologies":"HVAC systems with adjustable speed and energy-efficient circulation mechanisms","People":"Building occupants, visitors, and workers","Owner":"Building management and facility maintenance staff"},{"Description":"Lack of clear ventilation rate guidelines for minimizing airborne virus transmission","Impact":"Uncertainty in reducing infection risk and potential higher transmission rates","Mitigation":"Further research on the ventilation rate needed to minimize transmission of airborne viruses, and development of specific guidelines for pandemic-related ventilation standards","Technologies":"Ventilation measurement and monitoring technologies, research on aerosol transmission dynamics","People":"Public health authorities, building designers, and HVAC engineers","Owner":"Research institutions, health organizations, and industry associations"},{"Description":"Debate on the applicability and use of the Wells-Riley model for estimating infection risk during COVID-19","Impact":"Uncertainty in assessing and managing infection risk in indoor environments","Mitigation":"Further debate, study, and consensus building on the use and application of the Wells-Riley model in the context of COVID-19, with validation by multiple research groups","Technologies":"Simulation and modeling software, airflow and particle tracking technology","People":"Research communities, public health experts, and policymakers","Owner":"Research institutions, public health organizations, and academic institutions"}]}
